Join Hispanic Hackers.text: Join us and get connected with your one-stop-shop for getting in touch with industry professionals, opportunities, and resources.

Hispanic Hackers Office Hours.text: Hispanic Hackers hosts weekly online office hours where we chat about our latest projects, bugs, interests.

Free Udemy Courses Through GALE.text: GALE Presents provides a free version of the Udemy platform through public libraries and institutions.

W3Schools Coding Tutorials.text: W3Schools is a free educational website providing resources for learning code. W3Schools is and will always be a completely free developer resource.

Hispanic Hackers Events.text: Hispanic Hackers hosts Meetups in Austin and online! Join us for a social, professional event, or office hours.

Austin Public Library.text: Austin Public Library (APL) is a free resource for residents living in Austin, Texas, providing library programs, technology, collections, and space at 20 library branches.

Round Rock Public Library.text: If you're a resident of Round Rock, Texas, RRPL is a free resource alternative to the Austin Public Library, providing much of the same services.

Latinas in Tech.text: Latinas in Tech is a non-profit organization with the aim to connect, support, and empower Latina women working in tech. LiT works to create safe spaces for learning, mentorship and recruitment.

Techqueria.text: Techqueria is a non-profit organization aiming to empower Latin√© professionals and support their advancement in the tech industry with educational initiatives, networking opportunities, or other forms of assistance

AUTMHQ.text: Austin Urban Tech Movement is a non-profit organization bridging the gap between the Black and Hispanic communities and the technology industry through job placement, career development, and networking opportunities.

FIESTA.text: New to Austin? Trying to break into the tech space? FIESTA stands for Founders, Investors, Entrepreneurs, Startups, Techies, and Austin newcomers and is Austin, Texas' fastest growing founder meetup.

SHPE.text: The Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers is a non-profit for engineers, computer scientists, mathematicians, scientists, and more with national professional and university chapters.

Prospanica.text: Originally the National Society of Hispanic MBA's, Prospanica advocates for the advancement of Hispanic professionals, finding innovative avenues for our community to achieve its full potential.

Latinitas.text: Latinitas is a non-profit with the goal of empowering all girls to innovate through media and technology. Latinitas hosts after school, summer camp, and coding programs.

Austin Non-Profits.text: Austin Non-Profits is a coalition of non-profit organizations with the goal of sharing resources, opportunities, and community across Austin.

ChatGPT.text: ChatGPT is a free AI system offering a live chatbot with the capability of outlining code, writing content, and providing relatively accurate information.

Visual Studio Code.text: VSCode is one of the most popular Integrated Develpment Environments (IDEs) used by programmers. It offers an integrated system for almost every major programming language.

Inkscape.text: Inkscape is a free alternative to Adobe Illustrator used to create vector graphics, logos, and art.

Gimp.text: Gimp is a free alternative to Adobe Photoshop used to edit photos and create graphics, logos, and art.

Toools.design.text: Looking for the right tool? Toools is a catalogue of free and paid tech and design resources with a list of websites offering icons, photos, fonts, and more.

Figma.text: Figma is one of the most popular prototyping interfaces. Offering a free version with online collaboration options as well as a desktop app, Figma is simple and used across the industry.
